185609027.review:
I have never come across a game before that has made me go from pure enjoyment to genuinely want a refund the longer it's been out.
When I first bought this game, I loved it. I greatly enjoy digging holes and this was, in some ways, even better than Space Engineers for that. Then I had to put it aside for while and have recently came back to it to discover that apparently changing the games name turns it into an even more buggy mess. Came back to discover my save files gone, no biggie I'm used to early access, I'll start again. I just about get to the point where I don't have to Hog Pan anymore ie. into excavation and automation, and suddenly I can't put down my gold pan. Again, no biggie, I'll just reload right? No, enter the BSOD every time I try to load that save, both the manual save I did right before the bug occured and a significantly earlier autosave. This is beginning to be a bit of a pain in the ass but I figure I'll give it one more go, maybe it was an anomaly, nope wrong again. First pan I did, same glitch, same BSOD attached. F**K this game, it will never grace my hard drive again.

TL:DR Dev's took a decent enjoyable cheap game and broke it over the space of two years.
185609027.developer_response:
Hello, thank you for your review. I'm sorry to hear about the issues you've encountered. If you played our game before the rebranding, we want to let you know there is a way to recover your old saves. To do this, you'll need to copy your old save files from the previous folder to the new one. You can find these folders in AppData\LocalLow\CodeHorizon

However, I'm particularly concerned about the fact that you're experiencing a BSOD. We’d love to learn more about your case. Please consider reporting this bug on our Discord; we’ll do our best to address the issue you're facing. On our Discord, you'll also find a more detailed guide on how to recover your old saves.

Once again, thank you for your review!

185595041.review: I've tried everything i can think of but i can not get the controls to work with mouse keyboard and with a controller still same problem i'm able to pick items up but can not fine tune the item to turn it or even place it. I've gone threw the setting no where can i adjust those settings.. very disappointing
185595041.developer_response:
Hello, we're sorry to hear that the game didn't meet your expectations. Nonetheless, thank you for your review.

Assuming you're using the default control settings, if you'd like to precisely adjust something, hold the right mouse button – this will allow you to rotate the item you're holding. Once you've finished rotating it, you can crouch by pressing C and then E to drop the item. Please note – you cannot rotate an item while crouching! Crouching will also help ensure the item doesn't topple over.

If you have any further questions about the game, we encourage you to participate in discussions on Steam or on our Discord, where our active community will be happy to assist you.

Thanks again for your review.

185535277.review: Voll drauf hängen geblieben auf dem Spiel Absolut geil das Spiel

185532259.review:
To pełna wersja czy early Early Access?

Fizyka napisana na kolanie. Można kupić silnik z działającą fizyką, albo można zrobić ją tak bardzo na odwal się, jak się tylko da. Ludzie i tak kupią. 
Pojazdy nie mają normalnego napędu, tylko dwa tryby: cała naprzód i cała wstecz, dzięki czemu precyzyjne ustawienie do podłączenie przyczepy wkurza. 
Samochód porusza się głównie siła bezwładności, jak się go rozpędzi i nieopatrznie dotknie kierownicy, to leci bokiem aż w coś trafi. 
Nigdy nie wiem czy grudki ziemi, szczególnie te które lecą z zamkniętej łyżki koparki, to efekt graficzny, czy faktyczna strata urobku. 

Grafika nie powala, a efekty pogodowe przyprawiają o łzy. I to nie są łzy szczęścia. Statyczne miasto, puste ulice, tory kolejowe bez pociągów. W charakterze sprzedawcy w sklepie występuje elektroniczna kasa, większość NPC zastąpiono drzwiami do budynków. Klikasz na drzwi banku i sprzedajesz złoto. 
Pod pewnymi kątami (sporą ilością kątów) tekstury znikają i można pod nie zajrzeć. 

Interfejs antyintuicyjny. To że ja się w nim gubię i kombinuję czterdzieści minut czemu nie mogę przyczepy podłączyć to pół biedy. Ale wchodzę na youtube, a tam biedny youtuber miota się z tym samym. W końcu udaj się znaleźć odpowiedź. Nie da się podłączyć przyczepy z wiaderkiem w środku. Nie da się i już. Przy okazji dowiedziałem się że jedyny akceptowany przez grę sposób zakończenia dzierżawy maszyn, to sprzedać je. Jeśli się je zwróci, to gra nadal będzie naliczała koszty wynajmu. Ciekaw jestem autora tego arcyciekawego rozwiązania. Chciałbym od niego pożyczyć Mercedesa. 

Balans. W grze jest tryb samorodków, który odpala się automatycznie, informując, że nie powinno się z niego korzystać. Wprowadzono go, ponieważ pierwszy etap był długi, żmudny i nudny. Nie poprawiono go, tylko dodano tryb, z adnotacją żeby z niego nie korzystać. 

Samouczek. Kiedy zakupię nowy sprzęt, zawiozę na działkę i spróbuje użyć, gra natychmiast wyświetla mi film pokazujący jak ten sprzęt można kupić. Przydatne, nie powiem. 

Przetapianie złota. Trzeba kliknąć na drzwi, poczekać 15 minut in-game i znów kliknąć na drzwi. Jako że nikt nie będzie specjalnie dwa razy do miasta latał, po jedną sztabkę, to na ogół jest super fascynujące 2-3 minuty patrzenia się na drzwi. 

O tym że ceny nie mają żadnego przełożenia na rzeczywisty świat, to chyba nie muszę pisać. 

Znajdźki. W grze oczywiście są znajdźki. Czy serio jest ktoś kto kupuję gry, bo mają system znajdziek?

System levelowania bez sensu też jest. Działce trzeba kupować sloty na ciężkie maszyny, bo inaczej nie można ich tam dostarczyć. Sama działka się nie zmienia, zmienia się tylko ilość slotów. 

Plusy. Plusy oczywiście są. Fajnie się kopie koparką. Kropka. 

Zasadniczo dałoby się wymieniać dłużej. To powyżej to pierwsze co nasuwa mi się na myśl, w związku z tą grą. Nie do końca rozumiem czemu nie zwróciłem jej od razu. Może lubię koparki.

185023440.review: I love this game, well let me preface this, I love occupational sim games.  I enjoy the grindy nature of these types of games.  The dirt digging feels good, the washplants for gold reclamation are awesome.  The graphics look old because this game is older, but the new dev team is really trying to get it up to speed again with new DLCs and new bug patches, all of which are welcomed by the community.  I find myself coming back to this game whenever I want to work on my mining company for a month, then I'll go play something else, but I always come back.  Love it.

185016768.review: I started my adventure on console in the Discovery Channel era and been through the roughest and lowest of lows. I went to PC all to find the same issues and lack of attention. Code Horizon was limited in their ability as they were under the grip of the Mega Corp. Now things changed and CH is fully in control this game is starting to become a masterpiece of mining simulation. They have brought tons of updates and DLC, some rocky but benefits the miner and most of all a new claim. New machines and a refresh of a grind. Much needed breathe of fresh air. So tired of the same Old Arnold to Nighthawk grind. Drilling nugs to escape Old Arnold and fighting flying excavators and matrix like screen transitions riding in the truck. I must say this now but wouldn't then and that is the game is more enjoyable and playable with a bright future. If CH was going to give up it would have been in the rough patches with Discovery rather than now. Rumors of GMS 2 on the Horizon? I admit mulitiplayer would be game changing but wouldn't have that same feel. GMS 2 will make that happen.

We’d like to reassure you that the trailers were recorded using the in-game engine. Please make sure you’re using the highest graphical settings for the best visual experience. We’re aware of a minor bug causing trees to appear darker than they do in the trailers - it's going to be fixed soon. If you’re experiencing performance issues, please reach out to us on our Discord. Let us know the details of your system configuration and describe the specific problems you’ve encountered. This will help us better assist you.

184385128.review: This game has an excellent concept, however, the devs don’t know how to appeal to the crowd. There is a slew of negative comments covering very, very real issues. When the devs comments on these reviews they seem to push the blame onto the players and point out their “hard work”. Such hard work being paid DLC full of bugs, a quad that nobody asked for and a dog that literally ONLY sits in front of his doghouse and barks. The devs have been pointing out these insignificant updates in response to criticism of their work ethic all the while there are game breaking bugs that make it impossible to enjoy the game independent to whether you are a long term, competitive or casual player. My suggestion to the devs would be, first, to allow modding. If you’re not going to fix your games bugs, at least, at very least, put your greed aside and allow your community to do it for you. Secondly, stop making excuses to ignore comments suggesting ideas. Take in what your community wants and build your game around it. Great examples of this are Beamng drive and Project Zomboid. Thirdly, make a roadmap of where you’re going next so that your community is not left in the dark about what the game is going to be in the future. A roadmap sparks constructive conversation and allows feedback on ideas before they are fully implemented. I really love this game as a concept and want to see it succeed. Personally, from me to the Devs of Gold Mining Simulator, fix up this first game and do not mess up the second one.
184385128.developer_response:
Hi, thanks for your review!

We think it’s important to share some context. Gold Mining Simulator  is now developed by a different team than the one originally responsible for creating the game, back when it had a slightly different name.

When we took over, our first priority was completing the features the original developers had started, like the quad, dog (with limited abilities since it was our internship side project to help people get into the gamedev) and mini machines to learn more about the project. After that, we shifted our focus to improving the game and fixing bugs, but this has been a big challenge due to the technical debt we inherited.

About modding – we know this is something the community is excited about, and it’s definitely on our radar. That said, implementing modding support will take time, and we want to approach it the right way to ensure it works well for everyone.

We also want to emphasize that we’re always open to player feedback. We actively read reviews, Steam discussions, social media, and especially Discord. Many of the changes we’ve made recently, like bucket stacking and gold map improvements, came directly from player suggestions. Even Orange Beast DLC was designed for those asking for extended gameplay and bigger machines.

You mentioned a roadmap, and we completely agree it’s a great idea. We’re actually planning to share our next steps for GMS and the upcoming sequel soon, so stay tuned for that! You can also mention the most needed suggestion and fixes so we can add them to the roadmap ;)

It’s clear from your feedback and the time you’ve spent in the game that you really care about its potential, and we’re grateful for that. We’d love to have you join the conversation on our Discord. Constructive feedback, especially from dedicated players like you, is what drives us forward and helps us build not only a better GMS but an even stronger sequel.

What do you say – see you on Discord? 😊
Thanks again for taking the time to share your thoughts!

183945413.review:
I really wanted to like this game.  I gave it all of my patience but it is just a a hot mess.  I cannot think of a single aspect of this game that is done well.  The financial system is horrible.  The machine control system is tedious and overly frustrating.  The driving mechanics are dumb.  The mining has no positive qualities unless you just like grinding World of Warcraft style forever.  Skip this game (even with the current steep discount).  It isn't worth your time or money.  
Gameplay-  Boring. Tedious. Clunky.
Sound-  Meh.  Repeats a lot.  Misses the mark all over.
Graphics- I have a 3080 so not a low end machine and this game is not near what should be expected.  Yes, the price point means it isn't going to be perfect but even with settings at mediumish, this game slows to a crawl when more than the bare minimum is happening.
183945413.developer_response: Hi, thanks for your review. We truly value your feedback—constructive criticism like yours helps us improve the game and ensures the upcoming sequel will meet player expectations. We’re sorry to hear you’ve encountered issues and encourage you to report any bugs or share detailed suggestions about gameplay, performance, or sound on our Discord. This will help us better understand and address the problems you’re experiencing. Plus, our Discord is home to an active and friendly community that’s always willing to help with tips and advice. Thanks again for taking the time to share your thoughts!

183531670.review:
Haved over 3k ounces then it went to 0 ounces all of a sudden while doing a cleanout.
I haved been mining for 9 hours straight. Tried going to the menu and back still gone. This is such a game breaking bug for me.
